content.description: Start on lowest crimps, a bit high for a true sit start. Go up to the left to a ledge then up to an obvious pocket before making your way right on smaller holds. Head straight up the middle to the snake eyes before striking the lip!
content.location: Snake Eyes is facing the creek bed on the west side.

content.description: Crouch or sit start, whichever you prefer. Go up on the obvious hand holds and grab the arête when the holds run out. Drop down to the pads or climb over the knife edge top and slide down the mossy slab on the backside.

Sit start with left on sharp diagonal crimp and right on sloper. Pull up into the underclings, then use whichever holes you like to get to the crimp rail. Use a nice three finger pocket to go to the top and mantle. Avoid the arête.
content.location: This boulder is just right of Paper Thin.

content.description: Sit start matched on crimp block then make two hard moves before going to the lip. Climb up on significantly easier holds until you can stand up near the top. Named after Timmy Summers, who originally cleaned the line. Timmy passed away before he could get the send.
content.location: roof faces creek bed on west side, across from reservation wall

content.description: Low start on sloper ledge. Move up and around roof to sharp hold and pocket. Move out along the roof line on the lowest holds. Once to the arête, move up, finishing on the last jug before the dirty top.
content.location: On west side of creek bed, first route left of corridor between boulders.

content.description: Start as low as possible on the fin and work your way up using pinches, crimps, and heel hooks. Top out on the tip, being careful not to dab on the wall to the left.
content.location: Walk down at the PK Boulder and head right along the creek. This boulder will be on your right after a few minutes.

content.description: Fern has some great established moderates. Documentation is lacking.
